result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Florencio Q Bravo

records.addlTxt: Defendant Florencio Q Bravo not in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Florencio Q Bravo.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Florencio Q Bravo in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a plea and setntencing date. Court authorizes transfer of misdemeanor case for global resolution., Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Florencio Q Bravo in court with Attorney John Mathew Krejci; both appear in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is re-assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs due to the defendants lower pending matter 21CF3837. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04-04-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Florencio Q Bravo in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Florencio Q Bravo in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Florencio Q Bravo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Juan RB, Juan AR
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
